translated: When all of those become one, one focuses on the form of Great Vajradhara and so on. That is the process of attaining the appearance and so on, and this should be understood in the same way as the first process, which is applied to the examples of illusion and so on.

analyzed: phyi'i mngon par @191b byang chub pa'i rim pa dang nang gi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa'o //

original: ril por 'dzin pa ni lte ba'i dbus na gnas pa'i yi ge dang po'i 'od zer gyis ji srid mgo bo'i bar du khyab cing de las kyang snying ga dang / de las kyang rkang pa'i bar dang / de las kyang slar rim pa de nyid kyis rnam par spros te rang gi lus po mi snang bar byas te dang po'o //
analyzed: ril por 'dzin pa ni lte ba'i dbus na gnas pa'i yi ge dang po'i 'od zer gyis ji srid mgo bo'i bar du khyab cing de las kyang snying ga dang / de las kyang rkang pa'i bar dang / de las kyang slar rim pa de nyid kyis rnam par spros te rang gi lus po mi snang bar byas te dang po'o //
translated: The grasping of the whole is that the light rays of the first syllable located in the center of the navel pervade as far as the head, and from that, the heart, and from that, the feet, and from that, again by that very process, one's body is made invisible.

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas bshad par bya'o // sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa thabs las byung ba ni mi g-yo @192a * //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og nas bshad par bya'o //

translated: And that is to be explained later on, beginning with the verse, ‚ÄúThe night is the part of illumination, the radiance of the sun‚Äôs rays is the increase of illumination.üîΩ‚Äù

analyzed: zung 'jug gi rim pa la ni dbye ba gnyis te rgyu'i zung 'jug gi rim pa dang / 'bras bu'i zung 'jug gi rim pa'o //
translated: The stage of union has two divisions, the stage of union of the cause, and the stage of union of the result.

analyzed: de la rgyu'i zung 'jug gi rim pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /

analyzed: 'di la gtso bo ni 'od gsal ba las ldang ba 'bras bu nyid kho na nyin no //
translated: Here, the primary is the emergence from clear light, which is the result alone.

original: 'o na sdang ba dang mnyam par gzhag pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir zung 'jug gi rim pas sangs rgyas kyi sa thob par mi 'gyur ro zhe na smras pa /

translated: Now, if anger and meditative equipoise are mutually exclusive, one will not attain the stage of buddhahood by the stage of union.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gtan du mnyam par gzhag la ste phrin las gang dang gang mdzad pa de dang de ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa de rnams la g-yeng ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gtan du mnyam par gzhag la ste phrin las gang dang gang mdzad pa de dang de ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa de rnams la g-yeng ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Buddhas are always in meditative equipoise. Whatever actions they perform, those actions are not a cause of distraction for those who abide in samƒÅdhi.

analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi bzhugs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa dang / bstan pa'i bzhugs pa dang / snyoms par zhugs pa'i bzhugs pa dang / nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Because the Buddhas have four kinds of abiding: abiding in deportment, abiding in teaching, abiding in meditative concentration, and abiding in right contemplation.

original: bzhugs pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i spyod pa ste /
analyzed: bzhugs pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i spyod pa ste /
translated: Abiding is the activity of meditative concentration.

original: de la gang zhig sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku'i spyod pa mnyam par gzhag pa de ni spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang zhig sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku'i spyod pa mnyam par gzhag pa de ni spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Among them, the abiding in deportment is the abiding in the body of the Buddhas, which is their meditative concentration.

original: gang zhig de rnams kyis chos bstan pa la sogs pa'i gsung gi phrin las de ni bstan pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de rnams kyis chos bstan pa la sogs pa'i gsung gi phrin las de ni bstan pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The abiding in teaching is the abiding in the speech of the Buddhas, which is their teaching of the Dharma, etc.

original: gang zhig de rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa thugs kyi phrin las de ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa thugs kyi phrin las de ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The abiding in meditative concentration is the abiding in the mind of the Buddhas, which is their activity of mind in meditative concentration.

original: gang zhig de rnams kyi lha la sogs pa'i gam du 'ongs pa la thugs kyi phrin las de ni nang du yang dag 'jog gis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de rnams kyi lha la sogs pa'i gam du 'ongs pa la thugs kyi phrin las de ni nang du yang dag 'jog gis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The activity of mind of those who come into the presence of those gods and so on is the meditative equipoise.

original: de bas na sdang ba dang mnyam par gzhag pa dag la bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sdang ba dang mnyam par gzhag pa dag la bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed Ones are the same in being hostile and in being in meditative equipoise.

original: gang zhig de rnams kyis sems can gyi don du sna tshogs pa'i spros pa dang bcas pa'i phrin las mdzad pa de'i sa de rnams cung zad kyang g-yeng bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig de rnams kyis sems can gyi don du sna tshogs pa'i spros pa dang bcas pa'i phrin las mdzad pa de'i sa de rnams cung zad kyang g-yeng bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: And when they perform the various activities of benefit for sentient beings, they are not distracted from that meditative equipoise at all.

original: dper na sprin dang kha ba la sogs pa rnams kyis nam mkha'i khams la gnod pa med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sprin dang kha ba la sogs pa rnams kyis nam mkha'i khams la gnod pa med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the element of space is not harmed by clouds, snow, and so on.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis sems can gyi don mdzad kyang rang bzhin gyis nyams par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde rnams la rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo 'khor ba bzhin du mdzad pa thams @193a * //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis sems can gyi don mdzad kyang rang bzhin gyis nyams par mi 'gyur ro // de rnams la rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo 'khor ba bzhin du mdzad pa thams @193a * //
translated: Even though they perform benefit for sentient beings by the power of their previous aspirations, they do not naturally deteriorate.

original: cad 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: cad 'byung ba yin no //
translated: For them, all activity arises like the spinning of a potter's wheel.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig ma lus skyon rgyu brtag pa'i lta ba bud shing sreg par mdzad //
analyzed: gang zhig ma lus skyon rgyu brtag pa'i lta ba bud shing sreg par mdzad //
translated: The view that investigates the cause of all faults burns the fuel of faults.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi dbye ba'i yul ni rtsa med skyon rnams skyon med la //üîΩskyon med thugs rje'i rig pas sgyu ma'i skyes bu las la blo ldan pa //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi dbye ba'i yul ni rtsa med skyon rnams skyon med la // skyon med thugs rje'i rig pas sgyu ma'i skyes bu las la blo ldan pa //
translated: The object of the division of self and other is the faultless one who is without faults.

original: sngon gyi smon lam dbang gis 'khor lo bskor ba bzhin du las la 'jug //üîΩces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam dbang gis 'khor lo bskor ba bzhin du las la 'jug // ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The faultless one, the wise one, the illusory being, engages in actions like the turning of a wheel by the power of former aspirations.

original: ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa tsam dang de'i gnas pa tsam gyis sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i don grub pa yin te nges pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa tsam dang de'i gnas pa tsam gyis sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i don grub pa yin te nges pa kho na yin no //
translated: The fulfillment of the wishes of sentient beings is definitely only by the mere entry into and mere abiding in meditative stabilization.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: skyes bu gnas pa tsam gyis ni ;
analyzed: skyes bu gnas pa tsam gyis ni ;
translated: By the mere abiding of a being,

original: / de nyid yid bzhin nor bu ltar //
analyzed: / de nyid yid bzhin nor bu ltar //
translated: like a wish-fulfilling jewel,

original: rtsig pa sogs la brten pa rnams //
analyzed: rtsig pa sogs la brten pa rnams //
translated: those who depend on walls and so on

original: ci 'dod pa ni 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: ci 'dod pa ni 'byung ba yin //
translated: obtain whatever they wish for.

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ba dang de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ba dang de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: mnyam par gzhag dang ma bzhag pa //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag dang ma bzhag pa //
translated: Whether in equipoise or not,

original: gang du de dag dmigs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gang du de dag dmigs mi 'gyur //
translated: wherever they are, they are not observed.

original: rnal 'byor go 'phang mi zad pa //
analyzed: rnal 'byor go 'phang mi zad pa //
translated: The stage of yoga is inexhaustible,

original: de ni zung 'jug gyur pa yin //
analyzed: de ni zung 'jug gyur pa yin //
translated: that is the state of union.

original: zhes bya ba 'og nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'og nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated below.

original: da ni 'dir rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'dir rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Now, here we must investigate:

original: rim pa lnga po 'di rnams rnal 'byor pa gcig gis sgom pa yin nam yang na rnal 'byor pa lngas te /
analyzed: rim pa lnga po 'di rnams rnal 'byor pa gcig gis sgom pa yin nam yang na rnal 'byor pa lngas te /
translated: Are these five stages cultivated by one yogi or by five yogis?

original: gal te gcig gis sgom na de'i tshe rdo rje bzlas pa'i mtha' ru des 'bras bu thob par 'gyur te rim pa gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams ni don med pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te gcig gis sgom na de'i tshe rdo rje bzlas pa'i mtha' ru des 'bras bu thob par 'gyur te rim pa gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams ni don med pa yin te /
translated: If by one, then at the end of vajra repetition he would attain the result, and the second stage and so on would be pointless,

original: ma ning gi bzlas pa ni 'od gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma ning gi bzlas pa ni 'od gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the recitation of the neutral state is clear light itself.

original: gal te gang zag lngas sgom na de'i tshe 'od gsal ba tha dad par 'gyur te de yang 'dod pa yin te gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te gang zag lngas sgom na de'i tshe 'od gsal ba tha dad par 'gyur te de yang 'dod pa yin te gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If by five persons, then clear light would be multiple, and that is unacceptable because it is nondual.

original: thabs kyi dbye ba ni de kho na nyid kyi dbye ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thabs kyi dbye ba ni de kho na nyid kyi dbye ba sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The division of methods does not establish the division of reality.

original: bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyud bstan pa yin zhe na de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyud bstan pa yin zhe na de yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the tantras of action and so on are taught, that is not correct.

original: bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyud rnams la ni de kho na nyid gtso bo nyid du bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyud rnams la ni de kho na nyid gtso bo nyid du bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For in the tantras of action and so on, reality is not taught as the principal thing.

original: gal te de rnams gtso bo nyid du de kho na nyid dang ldan par gyur na de tshe gong nas gong du rgyud bstan pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de rnams gtso bo nyid du de kho na nyid dang ldan par gyur na de tshe gong nas gong du rgyud bstan pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If they were endowed with reality as the principal thing, then it would not be reasonable to teach the tantras in an ascending order.

original: bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyud kyis bstan pa 'di ni las dang po 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyud kyis bstan pa 'di ni las dang po 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: This teaching of the tantras of action and so on is for the sake of engaging beginners.

original: de ni drang ba'i don du bshad pa ste nges pa'i don du ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni drang ba'i don du bshad pa ste nges pa'i don du ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is explained as provisional meaning, not definitive meaning.

original: de bas na 'dir ji ltar gnas par bya'o @193b smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir ji ltar gnas par bya'o @193b smras pa /
translated: Therefore, here is how it should be understood.

original: 'dir ni rim pa lnga po gang zag gcig gi spyod yul yin te lnga po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni rim pa lnga po gang zag gcig gi spyod yul yin te lnga po ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the five stages are the domain of a single person, not of five.

original: byang chub yang gcig yin te thabs du ma yod kyang de tha dad par mi rigs te char pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub yang gcig yin te thabs du ma yod kyang de tha dad par mi rigs te char pa lta bu'o //
translated: Enlightenment is also one. Although there are many methods, it is not reasonable for them to be different, like rain.

original: dper na dbyar gyi dus su sprin gyi tshogs kyis bkag pa'i nam mkha'i dkyil nas char 'bab pa yang yin pa de ni gcig yin na yang bu ram gyi shing la bab na mngar bar 'gyur ba dang / de nyid tig ta la sogs pa la bab na kha bar 'gyur ba dang /üîΩsbrul gyis 'thungs na dug nyid du 'gyur ba ste de ltar 'od gsal ba gcig pu yin kyang bya ba'i rgyud la gnas pa rnams kyis lha'i rnam pa tsam du gzung ba dang / spyod pa'i rgyud la gnas pa rnams kyis sna tshogs pa'i spros pa'i spyod pa'i sgo nas gzung ba dang /
analyzed: dper na dbyar gyi dus su sprin gyi tshogs kyis bkag pa'i nam mkha'i dkyil nas char 'bab pa yang yin pa de ni gcig yin na yang bu ram gyi shing la bab na mngar bar 'gyur ba dang / de nyid tig ta la sogs pa la bab na kha bar 'gyur ba dang / sbrul gyis 'thungs na dug nyid du 'gyur ba ste de ltar 'od gsal ba gcig pu yin kyang bya ba'i rgyud la gnas pa rnams kyis lha'i rnam pa tsam du gzung ba dang / spyod pa'i rgyud la gnas pa rnams kyis sna tshogs pa'i spros pa'i spyod pa'i sgo nas gzung ba dang /
translated: For example, the rain that falls from the center of the sky blocked by a mass of clouds in the summer is one thing, but when it falls on sugarcane it becomes sweet, and when it falls on gentian and so on it becomes bitter.üîΩWhen it is drunk by a snake it becomes poison.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la gnas pa rnams kyis sngags dang phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbye bas gzung ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud la gnas pa rnams kyis sngags dang phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbye bas gzung ba'o //
translated: Thus, although it is only clear light, those abiding in action tantra apprehend it as merely the form of the deity, those abiding in conduct tantra apprehend it through the conduct of various elaborations, and those abiding in yoga tantra apprehend it through the divisions of mantra, seal, and samƒÅdhi.

original: rnal 'byor chen pa'i rgyud la gnas pa rnams kyis bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dbye bas de kha nyid gzung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen pa'i rgyud la gnas pa rnams kyis bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dbye bas de kha nyid gzung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those abiding in the stage of a great yogi should hold it by way of the division of the creation stage and the completion stage.

original: de la yang kha cig gis ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi dbye ba dang / kha cig gis lus rnam par dben pa dang / kha cig gis ngag rnams par de bzhin pa dang / kha cig gis yid rnam par dben pa dang / kha cig gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par dben pa dang /
analyzed: de la yang kha cig gis ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi dbye ba dang / kha cig gis lus rnam par dben pa dang / kha cig gis ngag rnams par de bzhin pa dang / kha cig gis yid rnam par dben pa dang / kha cig gis kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par dben pa dang /
translated: With regard to that, some hold it by way of the division of the three meditative stabilizations, some by way of the isolation of the body, some by way of the isolation of speech, some by way of the isolation of mind, some by way of the isolation of the conventional truth,

original: kha cig gis don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par dben pa dang / kha cig gis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la rag lus pa'i sgo nas dang / kha cig gis so sor sdud pa la sogs pa'i yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi sgo nas dang /
analyzed: kha cig gis don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par dben pa dang / kha cig gis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la rag lus pa'i sgo nas dang / kha cig gis so sor sdud pa la sogs pa'i yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor gyi sgo nas dang /
translated: some by way of the isolation of the ultimate truth, some by way of non-abiding nirvana, and some by way of the yoga of the six branches such as withdrawal.

original: kha cig gis phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang thig le bsgom pa'i sgo nas de kho na nyid du gzung bar 'gyur te spros pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig gis phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang thig le bsgom pa'i sgo nas de kho na nyid du gzung bar 'gyur te spros pa'o //
translated: Some, through the yoga of subtle [vajra recitation] and the meditation of the bindu, will grasp at reality, which is conceptual elaboration.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: chos ni 'di rnams sgra nyid brjod pas lung du bstan //
analyzed: chos ni 'di rnams sgra nyid brjod pas lung du bstan //
translated: These dharmas are taught through the expression of sound.

original: chos dang sgra dag 'dir ni gang yang mtshon mi bya //
analyzed: chos dang sgra dag 'dir ni gang yang mtshon mi bya //
translated: Dharmas and sound are not indicated here at all.

original: tshul ni gcig gyur yang dag de la zhugs nas su ;
analyzed: tshul ni gcig gyur yang dag de la zhugs nas su ;
translated: Having entered into that authentic state of oneness,

original: / bla med bzod spyod de la reg par gyis //
analyzed: / bla med bzod spyod de la reg par gyis //
translated: One should touch the unsurpassed acceptance and practice.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And so on.

original: de'i phyir na 'dir grub pa'i mtha' 'di nyid yin te las dang po pa'i gnas skabs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i cho ga'i dkyil 'khor 'dri ba'i rdo rje slob dpon @194a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'dir grub pa'i mtha' 'di nyid yin te las dang po pa'i gnas skabs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i cho ga'i dkyil 'khor 'dri ba'i rdo rje slob dpon @194a * //
translated: Therefore, this is the conclusion: The yogi/nƒ´ who is abiding in the state of a beginner, the vajra master who draws the ma·πá·∏çala of the glorious GuhyasamƒÅja,

original: gyis thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams las gang yang rung ba'i dkyil 'khor la rab tu zhugs te /
analyzed: gyis thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams las gang yang rung ba'i dkyil 'khor la rab tu zhugs te /
translated: having entered into any ma·πá·∏çala, such as the ma·πá·∏çala of Cittavajra, and so on,

original: de nyid la dam tshig dang sdom pa gsol ba sngon du 'gro ba'i rim pa dang / phyi mi ldog pa dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes kyi dbang rnams kyis dbang bskur la ;
analyzed: de nyid la dam tshig dang sdom pa gsol ba sngon du 'gro ba'i rim pa dang / phyi mi ldog pa dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes kyi dbang rnams kyis dbang bskur la ;
translated: and the wisdom-awareness empowerment, are conferred.

original: rang 'dod pa'i lha'i bsgom pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rang 'dod pa'i lha'i bsgom pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The meditation of the desired deity is given.

original: de nas slob ma des skye bo med pa'i sar phyin la dang po lus rnam par dben pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum gtso bor gyur pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa rnam par bsgoms la slar yang de la mthar thug pas mtshan ma bltas te /
analyzed: de nas slob ma des skye bo med pa'i sar phyin la dang po lus rnam par dben pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum gtso bor gyur pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pa rnam par bsgoms la slar yang de la mthar thug pas mtshan ma bltas te /
translated: Then, that disciple should go to a place without people and first meditate on the creation stage, which is mainly the three meditative stabilizations, in order to be isolated from the body.

original: ngag rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa bsgoms la /
analyzed: ngag rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa bsgoms la /
translated: Then, in order to purify the speech, meditate on the stage of vajra repetition.

original: de nas sems rnam par dben pa'i phyir sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa la bsgoms nas bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas so //
analyzed: de nas sems rnam par dben pa'i phyir sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa la bsgoms nas bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas so //
translated: Then, in order to be isolated from the mind, meditate on the stage of observing the mind, and then abide in the illusion-like meditative stabilization by the stage of self-consecration.

original: 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags par ma'i rim pas mngon par byang chub pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags par ma'i rim pas mngon par byang chub pa la zhugs te /
translated: Having entered into manifest enlightenment by the stages of passion, freedom from passion, and neutral feeling,

original: zung 'jug gi rim pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byas te /
analyzed: zung 'jug gi rim pas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byas te /
translated: he actualizes nonabiding nirvana by the stage of union.

original: sangs rgyas shing sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gshegs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas shing sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gshegs par 'gyur te /
translated: Having become a buddha, he goes from buddhafield to buddhafield in order to work for the welfare of all sentient beings without exception.

original: sgom pa po gang zag lnga ma yin te gcig kho na yin no //
analyzed: sgom pa po gang zag lnga ma yin te gcig kho na yin no //
translated: The meditator is not five persons but one person.

original: dper na dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i le'u bdun pa las gsungs pa'i de kho na nyid sgom par byed pa'i gang zag gcig lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i le'u bdun pa las gsungs pa'i de kho na nyid sgom par byed pa'i gang zag gcig lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the person who meditates on reality as it is taught in the seven chapters of the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: gang gi phyir der le'u re re la ni sgom pa po tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir der le'u re re la ni sgom pa po tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, the meditator is not different in each chapter,

original: le'u bcu bdun las bstan pa'i rim pa gnyis sgom par byed pa'i gang zag gcig bu kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: le'u bcu bdun las bstan pa'i rim pa gnyis sgom par byed pa'i gang zag gcig bu kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is just one person who meditates on the two stages taught in the seventeen chapters.

original: gang zhig rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa rnams la bar bar du'o gsal ba bstan pa de yang de nyid la khyab par byed pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang zhig rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa rnams la bar bar du'o gsal ba bstan pa de yang de nyid la khyab par byed pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: , because he teaches that it pervades those states.

original: de tsam gyis rim pa gzhan med par mi 'gyur bas rim pa mtha' ma khon las bya ba rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis rim pa gzhan med par mi 'gyur bas rim pa mtha' ma khon las bya ba rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: , because the process is not complete until the final stage, since it is not the case that there is no other stage beyond that.

original: de yang spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma las 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis mda' la goms pa'i dpe'i sgo nas rab tu bstan pa ste de nyid las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma las 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis mda' la goms pa'i dpe'i sgo nas rab tu bstan pa ste de nyid las shes par bya'o //
translated: This is taught by ƒÄrya-deva in the Lamp for the Compendium of Practice with the example of becoming skilled in archery. It should be understood from that text.

original: da ni 'di @194b rnams bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di @194b rnams bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, these should be explained.

original: 'dir gang zag tu dbang dang ldan pa yin nam zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir gang zag tu dbang dang ldan pa yin nam zhe na smras pa /
translated: Here, is the person one who is fit for the empowerment?

original: chos la rjes su 'brang ba rin po che lta bu'i gang zag rnams so //
analyzed: chos la rjes su 'brang ba rin po che lta bu'i gang zag rnams so //
translated: It is said that they are persons who follow the teachings and are like a jewel.

original: gang gi phyir gang zag ni rnam par gnyis te dad pa la rjes su 'brang ba dang chos la rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zag ni rnam par gnyis te dad pa la rjes su 'brang ba dang chos la rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: Because there are two kinds of persons: those who follow faith and those who follow the teachings.

original: de la dad pa la rjes su 'brang ba la ni bzhi ste tsandan lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dad pa la rjes su 'brang ba la ni bzhi ste tsandan lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who follow by faith are fourfold: like sandalwood, and so on.

original: de la tsandan ni dbang po dman pa dang / autpala ni dbang po 'bring dang / padma dkar po ni dbang po rab dang / padma ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: de la tsandan ni dbang po dman pa dang / autpala ni dbang po 'bring dang / padma dkar po ni dbang po rab dang / padma ni de bzhin no //
translated: Among them, the sandalwood person has weak faculties, the utpala person has medium faculties, the white lotus person has sharp faculties, and the lotus person is the same.

original: chos la rjes su 'brang ba ni rin po che lta bu'i gang zag gcig kho na yin no //
analyzed: chos la rjes su 'brang ba ni rin po che lta bu'i gang zag gcig kho na yin no //

analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni sgron gsal las gsungs te de nyid las shes par bya'o //

original: de la rin po che bzhin du sems can kun la 'dod pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni rin po che lta bu'i gang zag go //
analyzed: de la rin po che bzhin du sems can kun la 'dod pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni rin po che lta bu'i gang zag go //
translated: Among them, the person who is like a jewel is one who fulfills all the wishes of all sentient beings, like a jewel.

original: yang na tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan kho na rin thang med pa'i phyir rin po che ste de rnams gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan kho na rin thang med pa'i phyir rin po che ste de rnams gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Or else, the person who has the priceless qualities of morality and so on is called a jewel.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: tshul khrims ldan zhing drin med stsol //
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan zhing drin med stsol //

original: shes rab dang ldan tshar gcig pa //
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan tshar gcig pa //

original: thos nas yang dag par bstan //üîΩrin chen gang zag rab tu grags //
analyzed: thos nas yang dag par bstan // rin chen gang zag rab tu grags //

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //

original: de'i phyir dang pa la rjes su 'brang ba rnams ni bskyed pa'i rim pa bshad pa'i snod yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang pa la rjes su 'brang ba rnams ni bskyed pa'i rim pa bshad pa'i snod yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who follow faith are vessels for the explanation of the creation stage.

original: chos la rjes su 'brang ba rnams ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i snod du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: chos la rjes su 'brang ba rnams ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i snod du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Those who follow the Dharma are vessels for the completion stage.

original: da ni nyan pa po rnams 'jug par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa la sogs pa lnga po bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni nyan pa po rnams 'jug par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa la sogs pa lnga po bshad par bya ste /

analyzed: de med na de rnams 'jug par mi 'gyur bas rab tu byed pa rtsom pa don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de la rim pa lnga pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i brjod pa'o //

original: bsgrub bya nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa ni brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa ni brjod par bya'o //
translated: The expression is the vajra repetition and so forth, which are manifestly desired as the objects of attainment.

original: de dag la thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa'o//
analyzed: de dag la thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa'o//
translated: They are related in the sense that the former is the means and the latter is what arises from the means.

original: dgos pa ni ngag rnam par dben pa nas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i go 'phang thob pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni ngag rnam par dben pa nas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i go 'phang thob pa'o //
translated: The purpose is to attain the stage of nonabiding nirvana from the state of verbal isolation.üîΩThe ultimate purpose is to cause all beings to attain that nature.

analyzed: de'i yang dgos pa ni 'gro ba thams cad de'i rang bzhin du bya ba ste rim pa lnga pa'i mdor bsdus pa'i don to / // / de la re zhig dang por rab tu byed pa mdzad @195a * //
translated: The five stages are the meaning of the summary.

original: pa'i slob dpon gyis 'dod pa'i lha la bgegs bskrad pa'i phyir phyag 'tshal ba rtsom pa yin te /
analyzed: pa'i slob dpon gyis 'dod pa'i lha la bgegs bskrad pa'i phyir phyag 'tshal ba rtsom pa yin te /

analyzed: phyir ldog pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i dbye bas dbang po dang stobs kyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i sems las byung ba'i dge ba'i chos yin no //

analyzed: bgegs rnams ni me dge ba bcu'i yang dag par bsdus te rnam par 'tshe ba la sogs pa yin no //

analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba 'di dag la ni lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir 'gal ba yod pa ste /

analyzed: dper na 'dir grang ba'i reg pa med pa ste me'i khyad par nyid gnas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de la mthun pa ni gang zhig gzhung mdzad pas 'dod pa ma yin te /

original: gzhung la rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhung la rigs pa kho na'o //

original: dper na so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la rjes su mthun pa ni dge slong gi k'a ri k'a rnams kyi dang po phyag rgya 'tshal ba ste dpal gyi phun sum tshogs pa'i sa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

translated: For example, in the case of the pratimoksa vows, the homage at the beginning of the Kararikas of the bhiksus, which is in conformity with the vows, is as follows:üîΩI pay homage to the glorious, perfect Buddha,

original: chags pa dang bral ba'i bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba'i bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: de la slob dpon sh'akya 'od la yi dam gyi lha 'jam dpal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la slob dpon sh'akya 'od la yi dam gyi lha 'jam dpal la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa ni gang zhig gis gzhung mdzad pa mngon par 'dod pa ste bstan bcos dang rjes su mthun pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: dper na / 'jig rten dbang phyug mgon po la // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

original: snang ba'i phreng pa'i 'grel pa'i phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i phreng pa'i 'grel pa'i phyag 'tshal ba'o //

original: de ni bstan bcos mdzad pa'i yi dam gyi lha yin te /
analyzed: de ni bstan bcos mdzad pa'i yi dam gyi lha yin te /

original: rnam par rigs pa tsam grub pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rigs pa tsam grub pa la ni ma yin no //

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can ni bstan bcos dang / de mdzad pa dag gnyi ga la rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can ni bstan bcos dang / de mdzad pa dag gnyi ga la rjes su mthun pa ste /

analyzed: dper na kun du bzang po'i sgrub thabs las 'jam pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //

analyzed: 'dir yang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can yin te /

original: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain this,

analyzed: mgon po sems can kun bdag nyid //
translated: the protector, the nature of all sentient beings,

original: dpal ldan bde chen la btud de //üîΩrnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
analyzed: dpal ldan bde chen la btud de // rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
translated: having bowed to glorious great bliss,üîΩfollowing the Yoga Tantra,

analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim bshad bya //
translated: will explain the stage of vajra repetition.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim bshad bya //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim bshad bya //

analyzed: zhes pa ni rim pa rnam par phye zhing so sor bstan par bya zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: ci byas nas she na bcom ldan 'das bde chen ni rdo rje 'chang la btud de zhes bya ba ni lus ngag yid rnams kyis phyag 'tshal nas so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji lta bu yin zhe na /

analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag nyid ni chos kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de bzhin no //

analyzed: 'dir ni rang bzo bkag pa yin te yi ge'i don to //

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is he like?

analyzed: mgon po zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor pa'i tshogs kyis gsol ba btang cing mchod par 'gyur ba'o // gzhan yang dpal ldan zhes bya ba ni dpal ni @196a * //
translated: The protector is the one who is supplicated and worshipped by the assembly of the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: spyan la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, glorious is the glory of the eyes, etc.

original: de rnams gang la yod pa de dpal ldan te /
analyzed: de rnams gang la yod pa de dpal ldan te /
translated: The one who has those is the glorious one.

original: des ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gsang ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gsang ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor rab tu bstan to //
translated: By that, the ma·πá·∏çala of the five secrets of Great Vajradhara is fully taught.

original: yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Again, what is it like?

original: sems can kun bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sems can kun ni dam tshig sems dpa' dang ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' gsum ste /
analyzed: sems can kun bdag nyid ces bya ba ni sems can kun ni dam tshig sems dpa' dang ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' gsum ste /

analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag nyid ni rang gi sku gang la mnga' ba de ni sems can kun bdag nyid de /

analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal nas bshad par bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te spyi'i don to //

analyzed: mgon po zhes bya ba ni thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis gsol ba gdab par bya ba'o //

analyzed: dri ma med pa'i nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /

analyzed: rang rig pa tsam gang yin pa de la phyag 'tshal ba ni de'i rang bzhin du rtogs nas /
translated: Homage to that which is mere self-awareness, having realized its nature,

analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa bshad par bya zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te yang spyi'i don to //

analyzed: mgon po ni 'od gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du mgon po dang 'dra ba'i dkyil 'khor pa'i nang na dbang phyug go //

original: dpal ni kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'i brgya byin gyi gzhu dang 'dra ba'i 'od zer te yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs gnyis las 'das pa gang la mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //

analyzed: de la btud de zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi sku la dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: sems kun gyi bdag nyid ni byang chub kyi sems te de nyid khams thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mgon po'o //

original: kunda dang 'dra ba'i phyir dpal ldan no //
analyzed: kunda dang 'dra ba'i phyir dpal ldan no //
translated: Glorious because of being like the jasmine flower.

original: mtshan ma gnyis yang dag par sbyar bas bde ba chen po gsal pa'i phyir bde chen te /
analyzed: mtshan ma gnyis yang dag par sbyar bas bde ba chen po gsal pa'i phyir bde chen te /

analyzed: de la btud de zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang dang tha mi dad par shes nas rdo rje bzlas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te yang sbas pa'i don to //

analyzed: de rnams kyang khyab par byed pa nyid du gnas pa'i phyir sems can kun gyi bdag nyid do //

analyzed: mgon po ni zla ba dang nyi ma dang mtshams kyi snang ba gsum dang bral ba'o //

analyzed: dpal ldan zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu la sogs pa'i mtshan ma lngas mdzes pa'o //

analyzed: bde chen zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te yang dag pa'i mtha'i bdag nyid do //

analyzed: de la btud de zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid du rjes su zhugs nas so //

analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin te mthar thug gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the ultimate is as before, in the phrase, ‚Äúvajra repetition, etc.‚Äù

analyzed: de bzhin du kun ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste de ni sna tshogs su so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, all is the conventional truth, because it appears as a variety of individual things.

analyzed: sems can ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste yod pa'i dngos po rnams kyi de kho na nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de dag pa dag nyid ni rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni sems can kun bdag nyid do //

analyzed: mgon po zhes bya ba ni ji srid bskal pa grangs med pa'i bar du //
translated: The Protector is so called because he is served by the Bodhisattvas, the Lords of the ten stages, for as long as the world exists.

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsnyen par gyur pa ste longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni mi 'jig pa'i rtag pas bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //

original: zag pa med pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dpe med pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi'i char bab pas mchog gi dga' ba stsol ba'i phyir bde chen te /

original: kyi de kho na nyid bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: kyi de kho na nyid bsgom pa'o //
translated: the divisions of the seat, the purity of the intermediate existence, and meditating on the reality of the dharmadhatu.

original: rjes su rnal 'byor la ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rjes su rnal 'byor la ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Subsequent yoga has two aspects:

original: dam tshig sems dpa' dang ye shes sems dpa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa' dang ye shes sems dpa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: the commitment being and the gnosis being.

original: shin tu rnal 'byor la ni rnam pa gsum ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched byin gyis brlab pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnal 'byor la ni rnam pa gsum ste phung po dang khams dang skye mched byin gyis brlab pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: Great yoga has three aspects: the divisions of the consecration of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.üîΩSupreme yoga has one aspect: the consecration of the three seats.

original: rnal 'byor chen po ni rnam pa gsum ste sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po ni rnam pa gsum ste sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The great yoga is threefold, divided into the blessing of body, speech, and mind.

original: kun bsdus na dang po'i sbyor ba'i dbye ba bco brgyad do //
analyzed: kun bsdus na dang po'i sbyor ba'i dbye ba bco brgyad do //
translated: When all are combined, there are eighteen divisions of the first yoga.

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi dbye ba brgyad de phyag rgya'i dbye ba dang / phyag rgya 'dus bya ba dang rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rab tu bzhugs pa dang / padma'i nang du dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spro pa dang /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi dbye ba brgyad de phyag rgya'i dbye ba dang / phyag rgya 'dus bya ba dang rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rab tu bzhugs pa dang / padma'i nang du dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spro pa dang /
translated: The supreme king of mandalas has eight divisions: the division of the seals, the union of the seal, the union of the vajra and lotus, the entry of all tathƒÅgatas, the emanation of the pledge mandala in the lotus,

original: phyi rol du spro ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur ba dang rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du spro ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur ba dang rgyas btab pa'o //
translated: the emanation externally, the irreversible empowerment, and the seal.

original: las kyi rgyal po mchog ni rnam pa bcu gnyis te phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang / bzlas pa'i cho ga dang / bya ba byas pa 'od du zhu ba dang / lha mos bskul ba dang / slar yang ldang ba dang / langs nas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bstod pa dang /
analyzed: las kyi rgyal po mchog ni rnam pa bcu gnyis te phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang / bzlas pa'i cho ga dang / bya ba byas pa 'od du zhu ba dang / lha mos bskul ba dang / slar yang ldang ba dang / langs nas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bstod pa dang /
translated: The king of actions is supreme with twelve aspects: the yoga of subtlety, the rite of repetition, the melting into light of the one who has done his duty, the urging by the goddesses, the rising again, the praise of the five Tathagatas after rising,

original: tshim par bya ba'i cho ga dang / nang gi bdag nyid kyi sbyin sreg gi cho ga dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo nye bar bsdu ba dang / mchod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i gtor ma'i cho ga dang / gshegs su gsol pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: tshim par bya ba'i cho ga dang / nang gi bdag nyid kyi sbyin sreg gi cho ga dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo nye bar bsdu ba dang / mchod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i gtor ma'i cho ga dang / gshegs su gsol pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: the rite of satisfaction, the rite of inner fire sacrifice, the withdrawal of the mandala wheel, the rite of the sacrificial cake preceded by worship, and the rite of dismissal.

original: de ltar kun bsdus na bskyed pa'i rim pa ni dbye ba sum cu rtsa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun bsdus na bskyed pa'i rim pa ni dbye ba sum cu rtsa brgyad pa'o //
translated: Thus, if all is summarized, the creation stage is of thirty-eight divisions.

original: de'i rjes la rigs brgya'i dbye bas lus rnam par dben pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la rigs brgya'i dbye bas lus rnam par dben pa 'di yin te /
translated: After that, there is the isolation of the body by the division of the hundred clans.

original: phung po lnga ni re re de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin yin pas nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga ni re re de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin yin pas nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: Since each of the five aggregates is of the nature of one of the five Tathagatas, there are twenty-five.

original: khams bzhi ni re re dbye ba lnga yis nyi shu'o //
analyzed: khams bzhi ni re re dbye ba lnga yis nyi shu'o //
translated: The four elements are each divided into five, making twenty.

original: dbang po dang yul bcu po yang re re dbye ba lnga yis lnga bcu yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul bcu po yang re re dbye ba lnga yis lnga bcu yin no //
translated: The ten faculties and objects are each divided into five, making fifty.

original: de la me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga snang bas rigs pa rgya'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de la me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga snang bas rigs pa rgya'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The five wisdoms such as the mirror-like wisdom appear in them, and so they are the divisions of the petals.

original: de lta bu'i bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa la pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa la pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One who abides in such a creation stage is one who has perfected the creation stage.

original: des ni gang zhig gis rgyun ma chad par rtog pa'i rnal 'byor ba kur sti dang bcas par bsgom pa dang / gang zhig grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi 'gal ba'i chos rnams kyis gnod par mi 'gyur ba dang / gang zhig la zhal gsum phyag drug pa'i lha'i rnam pa mngon du gyur pa dang /
analyzed: des ni gang zhig gis rgyun ma chad par rtog pa'i rnal 'byor ba kur sti dang bcas par bsgom pa dang / gang zhig grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi 'gal ba'i chos rnams kyis gnod par mi 'gyur ba dang / gang zhig la zhal gsum phyag drug pa'i lha'i rnam pa mngon du gyur pa dang /
translated: This means that one who meditates continuously with the yoga of conceptualization, who is not harmed by the worldly discordant phenomena such as cold and heat, and in whom the form of the deity with three faces and six arms manifests,

original: gang zhig sna tshogs pa'i zhi ba @198b la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs la nus pa dang ldan pa dang / gang zhig bshad gci nyung ba dang / snying rje dang ldan pa gang zhig 'jig rten pa'i spyod pas g-yo bar mi nus pa de rnams bskyed pa'i rim pa la legs par gnas ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig sna tshogs pa'i zhi ba @198b la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs la nus pa dang ldan pa dang / gang zhig bshad gci nyung ba dang / snying rje dang ldan pa gang zhig 'jig rten pa'i spyod pas g-yo bar mi nus pa de rnams bskyed pa'i rim pa la legs par gnas ba ste /
translated: Those who are able to perform the various rites of pacification and so forth, who have little urine and excrement, who are compassionate, who cannot be swayed by worldly conduct, they are well-established in the stage of generation.

original: gang zhig gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sbrul gyis gzung ba dang sgom pa tsam la rag lus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sbrul gyis gzung ba dang sgom pa tsam la rag lus pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who are not are not, because they are dependent on the mere grasping and meditation of the snake of the afflictions such as desire.

original: rnal 'byor ba'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa dang / sems chung ba dang / thos pa chung ba de rnams ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa dang / sems chung ba dang / thos pa chung ba de rnams ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Those who are not are not, because they are not endowed with the pride of a yogin, and they are of little mind and little learning.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa la legs par gnas pa'i gang zag gang yin pa de rnams gang gi tshe rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'dod par 'gyur na de'i tshe de rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis thabs 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa la legs par gnas pa'i gang zag gang yin pa de rnams gang gi tshe rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'dod par 'gyur na de'i tshe de rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis thabs 'di gsungs so //
translated: When those persons who are well-established in the stage of generation desire the stage of completion, then the Blessed One taught this method to them.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩskas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na / skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //
translated: What is it like?üîΩIt is said to be like the steps of a ladder.

original: zhes bya ba ni skas kyi rim pas skyes pa 'dzeg na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skas kyi rim pas skyes pa 'dzeg na /
translated: If a person climbs a ladder,

original: de'i shin tu mtho ba'i khang bzangs kyi rtse mor phyin pa de bzhin du rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i thabs bzhi'i skas kyis thams cad kyi mchog zung 'jug gi go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i shin tu mtho ba'i khang bzangs kyi rtse mor phyin pa de bzhin du rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i thabs bzhi'i skas kyis thams cad kyi mchog zung 'jug gi go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will reach the top of a very high palace. In the same way, by the ladder of the four methods, such as vajra repetition, one will attain the stage of union, which is the best of all.

original: 'di ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshig snga ma bzhin du rang bzo bkag pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshig snga ma bzhin du rang bzo bkag pa'i don du'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement of the perfect Buddha, which refutes the idea that this is one's own invention.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'i bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the non-intentional.üîΩNow, in order to explain the reality of the winds, the reality of the mantra, and the reality of the winds that are the support of vajra repetition,

original: da ni rlung gi de kho na nyid dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid dang / rdo rje bzlas pa'i rten du gyur pa'i rlung gang yin pa de nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang dbye ba rnams pas na ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rlung gi de kho na nyid dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid dang / rdo rje bzlas pa'i rten du gyur pa'i rlung gang yin pa de nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang dbye ba rnams pas na ba'i phyir /
translated: the nature and the divisions of the winds are explained.

original: sems can rnams kyi srog gyur pa //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi srog gyur pa //
translated: The winds are the life of sentient beings,

original: rlung zhes bya bsams kun byed //
analyzed: rlung zhes bya bsams kun byed //
translated: and they perform all functions of the mind.

original: 'di ni rnam shes bzhon ba ste //üîΩlnga yis bdag nyid bcu yang yin //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam shes bzhon ba ste // lnga yis bdag nyid bcu yang yin //
translated: This is the mount of consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is the five, and also the ten.

original: de la rlung zhes bya ba ni khams chen po'i mchog gyur yin pas de rlung gi de kho na nyid la sogs pa'i rten yin no zhes ngag gi lha mo'o //
analyzed: de la rlung zhes bya ba ni khams chen po'i mchog gyur yin pas de rlung gi de kho na nyid la sogs pa'i rten yin no zhes ngag gi lha mo'o //
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúwind‚Äù is the supreme of the great elements, and so it is the support of the reality of the winds and so forth.

original: 'on rlung de phyi'i yin nam ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on rlung de phyi'i yin nam ma yin zhe na /
translated: Is that wind internal or external?

original: sems can rnams kyi srog gyur pa //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi srog gyur pa //
translated: It is the life of sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rigs drug dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srog tu gyur pa mi srog gi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rigs drug dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srog tu gyur pa mi srog gi rang bzhin te /
translated: It is the life of the six types of migrating beings and the life of the form and formless realms.

original: des tshim par gyur na de rnams kyis g-yo ba'i ming thob pa yin te gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: des tshim par gyur na de rnams kyis g-yo ba'i ming thob pa yin te gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: When it is satisfied, they obtain the name ‚Äúmoving,‚Äù and not otherwise.

original: de bzhin las kun byed ces bya ba ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / 'phyo ba dang / man na pa dang / 'dzeg pa dang / thur du 'gro pa la sogs pa dang / 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin las kun byed ces bya ba ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / 'phyo ba dang / man na pa dang / 'dzeg pa dang / thur du 'gro pa la sogs pa dang / 'byung ba dang /
translated: It performs all actions.

original: 'jug pa dang / @199a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang / @199a * //
translated: and the action of going.

original: gnas pa dang / mdor bsdus pas gnas pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang 'gro ba rnams byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa dang / mdor bsdus pas gnas pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang 'gro ba rnams byed pa ste /
translated: It is the action of entering, remaining, and summarizing the state of remaining, sitting, lying down, and going.

original: de ni don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin 'od la bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin 'od la bstan pa ste /
translated: It is taught to be the nature of Amoghasiddhi,

original: las thams cad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the agent of all actions.üîΩSimilarly, all actions are pacifying, controlling, destroying, expelling, separating, and killing.

original: de bzhin du las kun ni zhib dang / dbang dang / mngon spyod dang / bskrad pa dang / rnam par sdang ba dang / gsod pa ste de rnams byed pas na las kun byed pa'o //üîΩde yang / ya yi don gyis gang ci'ang rung //
analyzed: de bzhin du las kun ni zhib dang / dbang dang / mngon spyod dang / bskrad pa dang / rnam par sdang ba dang / gsod pa ste de rnams byed pas na las kun byed pa'o // de yang / ya yi don gyis gang ci'ang rung //
translated: Since it is the agent of those, it is the agent of all actions.üîΩMoreover,

original: dngos grub 'dod pas bya ba ni //
analyzed: dngos grub 'dod pas bya ba ni //
translated: whatever is to be done by one who desires power

original: ral sogs pa gsum nyid kyis //
analyzed: ral sogs pa gsum nyid kyis //
translated: is to be done with the three, the sword, and so on,

original: 'gro ba'i don la 'jug par bya //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don la 'jug par bya //

original: zhes bya ba 'di 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained below.

original: rlung de yang rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa yin nam ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: rlung de yang rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa yin nam ma yin zhe na /
translated: Is that wind different from consciousness or not?

original: 'di ni rnam shes bzhon pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam shes bzhon pa ste //
translated: It is the mount of consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba ni rlung 'di nyid 'jug pa'i rnam par shes ba drug gi bzhon pa ni bzhir gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rlung 'di nyid 'jug pa'i rnam par shes ba drug gi bzhon pa ni bzhir gyur pa'o //

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pas de la zhon nas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug gi sgo nas gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug po yongs su spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pas de la zhon nas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug gi sgo nas gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug po yongs su spyod pa yin no //
translated: Because consciousness, riding on it, experiences the six objects such as visible form by means of the six sense organs such as the eye.

original: de yang gang gi phyir de la des bskul bal rag lus pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir de la des bskul bal rag lus pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: And that is because consciousness itself is impelled by it.

original: gzhan du na des ni long ba bzhin du ci yang mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na des ni long ba bzhin du ci yang mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de bas na 'phye bo dang long ba bzhin du 'di dag la 'brel pa yod na don gyi bya ba 'grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when they are connected, the function of the object is accomplished, as in the case of a lame man and a blind man.

original: 'dis ni 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: ji ltar rta dang rta pa lam du zhugs pas khyad par gyi bya ba rdzogs par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rta dang rta pa lam du zhugs pas khyad par gyi bya ba rdzogs par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a horse and a rider who have set out on a road complete the special function,

analyzed: rlung dang rnam par shes pa dag 'brel na yul bzung ba'i nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //

original: 'di dag la de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag la de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa ste /
translated: They have a connection that has the characteristic of identity.

original: shing dang shun pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: shing dang shun pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a tree and its bark.

original: 'di tsam gyis rlung gi mtshan nyid bstan no /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis rlung gi mtshan nyid bstan no /
translated: This much explains the definition of wind.

original: // / de nyid kyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / de nyid kyi dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain its divisions, it says

original: lnga'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lnga'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: ‚Äúhaving the nature of five.‚Äù

original: de yang rnam pa lnga ste srog dang rtsol ba dang / thur du sel ba dang / me dang mnyam pa dang gyen du 'gro ba dang khyab byed kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga ste srog dang rtsol ba dang / thur du sel ba dang / me dang mnyam pa dang gyen du 'gro ba dang khyab byed kyi dbye bas so //
translated: It has five aspects: life-force, exertion, downward-voiding, fire-coinciding, upward-moving, and pervading.

original: de la rlung bcu ni rdo rje'i zhal zhes bya ba'i rnal 'byor chen po'i zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud las gsungs te /
analyzed: de la rlung bcu ni rdo rje'i zhal zhes bya ba'i rnal 'byor chen po'i zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud las gsungs te /
translated: The ten winds are mentioned in the Vajra Face Tantra, a tantra of the Great Yoga class.

original: de'i nang nas kyang dang po phyung po lnga'i rlung gnas kyi dbye ba dang las kyi dbye bas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i nang nas kyang dang po phyung po lnga'i rlung gnas kyi dbye ba dang las kyi dbye bas bshad par bya ste /
translated: From among those, I will explain the five root winds in terms of their locations and functions.

analyzed: de la srog ga rlung ni snying gar gnas pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa @199b mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin yin no // thur du sel ba'i rlung ni bshad sgo la gnas pa ste rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rang bzhin no // gyen du 'gro ba'i rlung ni mgrin par gnas pa ste /
translated: The life-force wind resides in the heart and is the nature of Ak·π£obhya.üîΩThe downward-voiding wind resides in the anus and is the nature of Ratnasa·πÉbhava.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The upward-moving wind resides in the throat and is the nature of AmitƒÅbha.

original: me dang mnyam pa'i rlung ni lte bar gnas pa ste don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin no //üîΩkhyab byed ni yan lag thams cad kyi tshigs la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: me dang mnyam pa'i rlung ni lte bar gnas pa ste don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin no // khyab byed ni yan lag thams cad kyi tshigs la gnas pa ste /
translated: The fire-accompanying wind resides in the navel and is the nature of Amoghasiddhi.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The pervading wind resides in the joints of all the limbs and is the nature of Vairocana.

original: 'di rnams rim pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //

analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dang por slob pa dang ldan pa'i phyir phyi nas gang la yang slob pa ma yin te sgra 'byed pa lta bu'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ltar gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ltar gsungs te /

original: shes bya dang khyad med pa'i phyir @206a * //
analyzed: shes bya dang khyad med pa'i phyir @206a * //

original: de las rjes su thob pa'i shes pas sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan dang / chu zla dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang 'dra ba'i chos thams cad mthong ba yin te thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa 'dir zung 'jug gi rim par bshad do //

analyzed: 'di ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: This is the perfect yogi,

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'ang de //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'ang de //

original: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i //

analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi mchog ldan pa'i //

original: thams cad mkhyen par de nas 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen par de nas 'gyur //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa dang mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyis rnam par brgyan pa'i sku thams cad mkhyen pa'i sku ma lus pa'i khams gsum pa'i sems can gyi rang bzhin mkhyen pa'i rim pa 'di nyid las 'byung bar 'gyur te mthar thug

analyzed: pa'i bshad pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid kyi rdzu 'phrul bshad pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'das pa dang ni ma 'ongs dang // da ltar byung ba'i srid gsum ni // 'od gsal bas ni rnam dag pas //

analyzed: skad cig de la ma lus mthong // zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: rdzogs ba'i rim pa 'dod rnams la // thabs 'di rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: and desire the perfection stageüîΩfor them the perfect Buddha

analyzed: skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //

original: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //

original: 'od gsal bas ni rnam dag pas //
analyzed: 'od gsal bas ni rnam dag pas //
translated: By the clear light, the pure

analyzed: khams rnams ni don mang po dang ldan pas mthong ba ni 'dir mngon du byed pa'i don du'o //

original: ma lus pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ma lus pa de gang yin zhe na /

original: 'dir ni rigs pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rigs pa 'di yin te /

analyzed: 'dir ni dngos po thams cad don dam pa'i bden pa la rag lus te /

analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba kho na yin te dper na bu ram gyi mngar ba nyid dang / me'i tsha ba nyid lta bu'o //

original: de bas na 'od gsal rtogs na rang bzhin yongs su shes pas /
analyzed: de bas na 'od gsal rtogs na rang bzhin yongs su shes pas /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid gsal bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad rang bzhin gcig pa mthong bar 'gyur //

analyzed: dper na rgya mtsho'i 'gram du chu ni 'thung ba na //

analyzed: de yis de yi ma lus chu de shes par 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ba dang de bzhin du //üîΩdngos po gcig ni dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ba dang de bzhin du // dngos po gcig ni dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin nyid //
translated: And similarly:üîΩOne thing is the nature of all things,

analyzed: dngos po thams cad dngos po gcig gi rang bzhin te //

original: gang gis dngos po gcig de don dam mthong gyur na //
analyzed: gang gis dngos po gcig de don dam mthong gyur na //

original: de yis dngos po thams cad yongs su mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yis dngos po thams cad yongs su mthong bar 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir te drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir te drang ba'i don to //

original: 'od gsal @207a * //
analyzed: 'od gsal @207a * //

analyzed: ba kho na rnam par dag pa ste rang bzhin rnam par sbyang ba'i thabs so //

original: rnam par dag pa de la dmigs nas ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba'i snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i ye shes rnams mthong ba ni rang bzhin yongs su shes pas mngon du byed pa yin no//
analyzed: rnam par dag pa de la dmigs nas ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis brjod par bya ba'i snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i ye shes rnams mthong ba ni rang bzhin yongs su shes pas mngon du byed pa yin no//
translated: Having perceived that purification, the knowledge of the attainment of the appearance of the object of expression by the words of the future, etc., is the realization of the nature by means of knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin rnams ni gnyen po'i bye brag gis spang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin rnams ni gnyen po'i bye brag gis spang bar mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pa kho na nyid mngon du bya ba yin no //

original: skad cig ma ni 'od gsal rtogs pa'i skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma ni 'od gsal rtogs pa'i skad cig ma ste /

analyzed: 'dir bde ba chen po nyams su myong ba'i skad cig ma 'dod pa yin te nges pa'i don to //
translated: Here, the moment of the experience of great bliss is intended, the definitive meaning.

original: da ni rang bzo dgag par bya ba'i phyir lung tshad ma nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rang bzo dgag par bya ba'i phyir lung tshad ma nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to refute the personal fabrication, the validity of scripture should be explained.

original: dpal ldan 'dus pa'i rgyud du ni //
analyzed: dpal ldan 'dus pa'i rgyud du ni //
translated: In the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra,

original: de nyid 'di dag rgyas btab gnas //
analyzed: de nyid 'di dag rgyas btab gnas //

analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas / bla ma'i kha las rtogs par bya //

analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ni thams cad kyi ming gis sngar bshad pa'i rim pa lnga po gzung bar bya'o //

translated: The phrase that reality refers to the reality that is the nature of the instructions to be expressed by the five stages. That reality is sealed and hidden in the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra.

analyzed: gnas pa ni don shin tu zab pa'i phyir rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'o//

original: gal te rgyas btab pa yin na ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyas btab pa yin na ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is sealed, how can it be understood?

original: bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes 'brangs nas //
translated: Following the explanatory tantras,

original: zhes bya ba la bshad pa'i rgyud ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la bshad pa'i rgyud ni bzhi ste /

original: de rnams kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni de rnams kyi go rims kyis so //üîΩ'o na bshad pa'i rgyud kho na las rtogs par 'gyur zhe na de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni de rnams kyi go rims kyis so // 'o na bshad pa'i rgyud kho na las rtogs par 'gyur zhe na de yang ma yin te /
translated: Following them means following their order.

original: bla ma'i kha las rtogs par bya //
analyzed: bla ma'i kha las rtogs par bya //
translated: But if one understands from the explanatory tantras alone, then that is not so, because it is said, One should understand from the guru's mouth.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang ba tsam gyis rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //

translated: Because in the explanatory tantras, the teachings of the very profound esoteric instructions are not obtained as long as they are not obtained from a guru who understands reality.

original: de srid de rnams rtsa ba'i rgyud dang 'dra ba'i zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de srid de rnams rtsa ba'i rgyud dang 'dra ba'i zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is intended that they are like the root tantra.

original: de la rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i mdor bstan pa bshad pa'i phyir de la dang po kho nar rlung gi de kho na nyid bstan pa'i @207b tshig rtsa ba'i rgyud la 'jug par bya ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i mdor bstan pa bshad pa'i phyir de la dang po kho nar rlung gi de kho na nyid bstan pa'i @207b tshig rtsa ba'i rgyud la 'jug par bya ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain the brief indication of the stage of vajra repetition, it is said, ‚ÄúThere, one should enter the root tantra, the words which teach the reality of the wind.‚Äù

original: 'dir mdo sde dang / rgyud dang / rtogs pa dang / rab tu byed pa kun la rnam pa gsum du skabs bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir mdo sde dang / rgyud dang / rtogs pa dang / rab tu byed pa kun la rnam pa gsum du skabs bshad pa yin te /
translated: Here, in all the sutras, tantras, realizations, and treatises, the context is explained in three ways:

original: mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa dang / yang bshad pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa dang / yang bshad pa'i dbye bas so //
