translated: In order to explain that the yogi who is attached to vajra recitation does not need to engage in conduct and so on, it is said:

original: de la brtul zhugs bshad pa med //
analyzed: de la brtul zhugs bshad pa med //
translated: There is no explanation of conduct there.

original: phreng ba mi dgos dgag mi dgos //
analyzed: phreng ba mi dgos dgag mi dgos //
translated: There is no need for a rosary, no need for blocking.

original: gzung dang sbyin sreg las rnams dang // gcig nas gcig tu ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzung dang sbyin sreg las rnams dang // gcig nas gcig tu ldog par 'gyur //
translated: and the turning back from one to another.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /üîΩbrtul zhugs ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa de la mi dgos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / brtul zhugs ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa de la mi dgos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la longs spyod pas de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la longs spyod pas de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Ascetic practices, such as the perfections, are not necessary for that yogi, because he enjoys the five sense objects, and they are incompatible with that.

original: phreng ba ni sngags bzlas pa'i phyir de la gzung mi dgos te /
analyzed: phreng ba ni sngags bzlas pa'i phyir de la gzung mi dgos te /
translated: A rosary is not necessary for him, because he repeats the mantra,

original: rang bzhin du rgyu ba'i srog dang rtsol ba kho na phreng ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin du rgyu ba'i srog dang rtsol ba kho na phreng ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the rosary is just the natural movement of the life-force and exertion.

original: dgag mi dgos zhes bya ba ni sna'i rtse mo la sogs par blta ba dgag cing skyil mo krung bcings pa la sogs pa dgos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dgag mi dgos zhes bya ba ni sna'i rtse mo la sogs par blta ba dgag cing skyil mo krung bcings pa la sogs pa dgos pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not necessary to block, because it is not necessary to block the view at the tip of the nose, and so on, and to sit cross-legged, and so on,

original: dkyil 'khor bzhi'i shar ba'i dus 'od zer gyi thig le la sems dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhi'i shar ba'i dus 'od zer gyi thig le la sems dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is blocked in the bindu of light that arises in the four cakras.

original: gzung zhes bya ba ni bris sku dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la sems gtad pa mi dgos te /
analyzed: gzung zhes bya ba ni bris sku dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la sems gtad pa mi dgos te /
translated: It is not necessary to focus the mind on a painting, a moon mandala, and so on, because

original: mi 'jig pa'i de kho na nyid la gtan du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'jig pa'i de kho na nyid la gtan du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one abides forever in the reality of non-destruction.

original: sbyin sreg gi las kyang mi dgos te bud shing dang 'dra ba'i rnam par bzhi'i ngag gi rnam par rtog pa rdo rje bzlas pa'i mes sreg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin sreg gi las kyang mi dgos te bud shing dang 'dra ba'i rnam par bzhi'i ngag gi rnam par rtog pa rdo rje bzlas pa'i mes sreg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The rite of fire sacrifice is also unnecessary, because the fire of vajra recitation burns the four types of verbal discursive thought, which are like fuel.

original: de bzhin du mchod pa dang / gtor ma dang / rab tu gnas pa la sogs pa gzhan ma rnams kyang bya mi dgos te nang gi dbang yid kyi rim pas de dag thams cad grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mchod pa dang / gtor ma dang / rab tu gnas pa la sogs pa gzhan ma rnams kyang bya mi dgos te nang gi dbang yid kyi rim pas de dag thams cad grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the other rites such as worship, bali offerings, and consecration are also unnecessary, because all of them are accomplished by the inner rite of the mental stage.üîΩNow, in order to explain how one accomplishes the rites of pacification and so forth,

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las ji ltar sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bshad par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩya yi don gyis gang ci 'ang rung //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las ji ltar sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bshad par bya ba'i phyir / ya yi don gyis gang ci 'ang rung //
translated: it is said:

original: dngos grub 'dod pas bya ba ni //
analyzed: dngos grub 'dod pas bya ba ni //
translated: Whatever is to be done by one who desires powerüîΩis to be done with the three, ra and so forth,

original: ra la sogs pa gsum nyid kyis //
analyzed: ra la sogs pa gsum nyid kyis //
translated: by means of the three, ra and so forth,

original: 'gro ba'i don la 'jug par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don la 'jug par bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: one should engage in the welfare of the world.

original: yi ge yas nye bar mtshon pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor ni yi ge ya ste /
analyzed: yi ge yas nye bar mtshon pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor ni yi ge ya ste /
translated: The wind ma·πá·∏çala, which is indicated by the syllable ya, is the syllable ya.

original: des sgrub pa'i don ni ya'i don te drag po'i las yin no //
analyzed: des sgrub pa'i don ni ya'i don te drag po'i las yin no //
translated: The meaning of ya is the meaning of accomplishment, which is the function of wrath.

original: dngos grub ni de nyid kyi dngos grub ste de 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor bas ci yang rung ba ni drag po'i las gang yang rung ba bya'o //
analyzed: dngos grub ni de nyid kyi dngos grub ste de 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor bas ci yang rung ba ni drag po'i las gang yang rung ba bya'o //
translated: Siddhi is the accomplishment of that, and the yogi who desires that should perform any wrathful function.

original: de bzhin du ra la sogs pa gsum pos nye @223b bar mtshon pa'i me la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gsum gyis zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba'i don la rab tu 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ra la sogs pa gsum pos nye @223b bar mtshon pa'i me la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gsum gyis zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba'i don la rab tu 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the three beginning with ra indicate the three mandalas of fire, etc., which are the means of accomplishing the aims of beings such as pacification.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says:

original: me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang // chu ste so so'i dkyil 'khor du //
analyzed: me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang // chu ste so so'i dkyil 'khor du //
translated: In the individual mandalas of fire, wind, earth, and water,

original: thun ni phyed phyed dus su ni //
analyzed: thun ni phyed phyed dus su ni //
translated: in the periods of half a watch,

original: las ni gnyis gnyis gnas par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: las ni gnyis gnyis gnas par 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: two functions are located.

original: me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi las g-yas la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'byung ba'i kha dog dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer shar ba'i dus su /
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi las g-yas la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'byung ba'i kha dog dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer shar ba'i dus su /
translated: In the four mandalas of fire, etc., from the right door, etc., the functions of the red, etc., light rays which arise at the time of sunriseüîΩare located in the periods of half a watch.

original: thun ni phyed phyed kyi dus kyi par du las gnyis gnyis ni las bzhi gnas par 'gyur ba ni 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun ni phyed phyed kyi dus kyi par du las gnyis gnyis ni las bzhi gnas par 'gyur ba ni 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The two actions in each half-period make four actions, which are accomplished.

original: da ni rdo rje bzlas pas thar pa thob pa yin no zhes dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje bzlas pas thar pa thob pa yin no zhes dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate by means of an example that liberation is attained by means of vajra repetition,üîΩit is said:

original: mchod la brtson pas mchod par 'gyur //
analyzed: mchod la brtson pas mchod par 'gyur //
translated: One becomes worshipful by striving in worship,

original: bzlas la brtson pas rnam par dag /
analyzed: bzlas la brtson pas rnam par dag /
translated: one becomes pure by striving in repetition,

original: me la sbyin sreg brtson pas 'byor //üîΩbsam gtan brtson pas thar pa thob //
analyzed: me la sbyin sreg brtson pas 'byor // bsam gtan brtson pas thar pa thob //
translated: one becomes wealthy by striving in fire sacrifice,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and one attains liberation by striving in contemplation.

original: ji ltar mchod pa la brtson pa'i gang zag gis ni bla ma dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mchod pa la chags na /
analyzed: ji ltar mchod pa la brtson pa'i gang zag gis ni bla ma dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mchod pa la chags na /
translated: Thus, just as a person who strives in worship becomes attached to the worship of gurus, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas,

original: tshe 'di nyid du mchod par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar bzlas pa la brtson pa ni ngag gi bzlas pa la chags pa'i gang zag sdig pa zad pas rnam par dag par 'gyur pa dang ji ltar me la sbyin sreg brtson pa ni dam tshig gi me'i zhal nas ye shes kyi me tshom par byed pa'i
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid du mchod par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar bzlas pa la brtson pa ni ngag gi bzlas pa la chags pa'i gang zag sdig pa zad pas rnam par dag par 'gyur pa dang ji ltar me la sbyin sreg brtson pa ni dam tshig gi me'i zhal nas ye shes kyi me tshom par byed pa'i
translated: One who is diligent in recitation is a person who is attached to verbal recitation, who becomes pure by the exhaustion of evil, and one who is diligent in fire offerings is a person who obtains power by the flame of wisdom fire from the face of the fire of commitment.

original: gang zag gis 'byor ba thob pa ste de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang zag gis 'byor ba thob pa ste de bzhin du /
translated: Thus,

original: bsam gtan brtson pas thar pa thob //
analyzed: bsam gtan brtson pas thar pa thob //
translated: One who is diligent in meditation obtains liberation.

original: ces bya ba ni rdo rje bzlas pa la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor bas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi thar pa thob pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rdo rje bzlas pa la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor bas mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi thar pa thob pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This teaches that a yogin who is diligent in vajra recitation obtains liberation, which is characterized by nonabiding nirvana.üîΩIn order to teach that all powers are obtained from nonconceptuality alone,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa kho na las dngos grub thams cad thob pa yin no zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa kho na las dngos grub thams cad thob pa yin no zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn declares,

original: sngags pas de ltar shes nas ni //
analyzed: sngags pas de ltar shes nas ni //
translated: The mantrin, knowing thus,

original: 'gro na byis pa bzhin du spyod //
analyzed: 'gro na byis pa bzhin du spyod //
translated: should act like a child when going.

original: de nas mi rtag chos can gyis //
analyzed: de nas mi rtag chos can gyis //
translated: Then, by the impermanent nature of things,

original: gsang sngags rnams ni 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: gsang sngags rnams ni 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: the mantras are accomplished.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /üîΩde ltar shes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas a'a li dang k'a li'i rang bzhin gyi ngag gi spros pa shes nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / de ltar shes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas a'a li dang k'a li'i rang bzhin gyi ngag gi spros pa shes nas /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'gro ba'i nang na byis pa bzhin du spyod pa ni bstod pa dang smad pa la sogs pa'i ngag gi rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar gnas par bya'o //üîΩgang gi @224a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i nang na byis pa bzhin du spyod pa ni bstod pa dang smad pa la sogs pa'i ngag gi rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar gnas par bya'o // gang gi @224a * //
translated: Knowing thus, by the reasoning explained above, the yogi/nƒ´ should know the nature of ƒÅli and kƒÅli, and the elaborations of speech, and like a child among beings should abide free from the discursive thoughts of speech, such as praise and blame.

original: phyir 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de bstod pa dang smad pa gang yang med pa'o zhes rnal 'byor bas rnam par spyod na gang du yang chags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de bstod pa dang smad pa gang yang med pa'o zhes rnal 'byor bas rnam par spyod na gang du yang chags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because, if the yogi/nƒ´ analyzes, That which is the nature of clear light is not praised or blamed at all, then he/she will not be attached to anything.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos nyid kyi rgyu de las so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos nyid kyi rgyu de las so //
translated: Then means from that cause, the non-conceptual reality.

original: gsang sngags ni sprul la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsang sngags ni sprul la sogs pa ste /
translated: The mantras are emanation, etc.

original: de rnams 'grub par 'gyur ba ni rang rang gi las la nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams 'grub par 'gyur ba ni rang rang gi las la nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Their accomplishment is the capacity for their respective actions.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gang zag de rnams 'grub pa ma yin te sngags kyi de kho na nyid mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gang zag de rnams 'grub pa ma yin te sngags kyi de kho na nyid mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those persons who have conceptual thoughts are not accomplished, because they do not know the reality of mantra.

original: nye bar bsdu ba bshad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba bshad pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to explain the summary,

original: gsung gi rdo rje sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje sgrub pa ste /
translated: it is the accomplishment of Vajra Speech.

original: 'di ni sngags kyi de nyid gsal /
analyzed: 'di ni sngags kyi de nyid gsal /
translated: This is the clarity of the reality of mantra.

original: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of the three exalted wisdoms,

original: sems tsam la ni nges par sbyar //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni nges par sbyar //
translated: it is definitely applied to mind only.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te yid skyob pa 'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te yid skyob pa 'am /
translated: It is called ‚Äúmind-protection‚Äù or ‚Äúsubtle speech‚Äù

original: spas par smra pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spas par smra pa'i phyir /
translated: because it protects the mind or is the subtle speech.

original: sngags kyi rnam pa gnyis te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag go //
analyzed: sngags kyi rnam pa gnyis te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag go //
translated: Mantra has two aspects: cause and effect.

original: de la rgyu ni srog rlung dang 'bras bu ni sngags te /
analyzed: de la rgyu ni srog rlung dang 'bras bu ni sngags te /
translated: Therein, the cause is the life-force wind, and the effect is mantra.

original: de dag gi de nyid ni sngags kyi de nyid de /
analyzed: de dag gi de nyid ni sngags kyi de nyid de /
translated: Their reality is the reality of mantra.

original: rlung dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid gang yin pa ste gsang ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud dang / rgyud phyi ma dang / bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas phye ba yin no //
analyzed: rlung dang sngags kyi de kho na nyid gang yin pa ste gsang ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud dang / rgyud phyi ma dang / bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas phye ba yin no //
translated: The secret is the reality of the wind and the mantra, which is divided by following the Root Tantra, the Subsequent Tantra, and the Explanatory Tantra.

original: de gcig pur ma zad kyi rdo rje bzlas pa yang phye ba byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de gcig pur ma zad kyi rdo rje bzlas pa yang phye ba byas pa yin te /
translated: Not only that, but also the vajra repetition is divided.

original: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: gsung gi rdo rje grub pa ste //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje grub pa ste //
translated: The accomplishment of the vajra of speech

original: zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i dag gi rnam par dben pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i dag gi rnam par dben pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: is the accomplishment of the emptiness of the indivisible speech.

original: ngag gi rnam par dben pa de yang ngag gi rnam par rtog pa bzhi rnam par sbyangs nas thob pa yin no //
analyzed: ngag gi rnam par dben pa de yang ngag gi rnam par rtog pa bzhi rnam par sbyangs nas thob pa yin no //
translated: And that emptiness of speech is attained by purifying the four verbal discriminations.

original: de la ngag rnam pa gzhi ni dper na mtshan nyid kyi ngag dang / rmi lam gyi ngag dang / gnas ngan len la mngon par zhen pa'i ngag dang thog ma med pa'i dus kyi rnam par rtog pa'i ngag go //
analyzed: de la ngag rnam pa gzhi ni dper na mtshan nyid kyi ngag dang / rmi lam gyi ngag dang / gnas ngan len la mngon par zhen pa'i ngag dang thog ma med pa'i dus kyi rnam par rtog pa'i ngag go //
translated: Therein, the four kinds of speech are, for example, the speech of characteristics, the speech of dreams, the speech of attachment to negative tendencies, and the speech of beginningless time.
